page.title: 18HOUSING- Appleby
page.content: The two villages, Appleby and Roxby both exhibit a mixture of old and modern buildings. Appleby consists of four distict groups of old dwellings which can be divided into a{Manor House}and 13{low {ironstone cottages}built between 1725 and the turn of the century, 16 sandstone and brick village houses, built circa 1810, followed by 26 exhibtion houses, built in 1865 for the{Lord St Oswald.}The last group of four estate houses, built of engineering bricks circa 1900. The gaps between these old houses have been infilled with{modern houses and{bungalows}consisting of senior citizen bungalows, council houses, ex-police houses and converted chapel, barn and stables. A modern Vicarage (1933), an old Vicarage (1849), and a {thatched cottage}complete this village
